sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with complex coefficients
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations with complex coefficients:

\begin{align*}
3x-2y+4z &= -1+2i \\
2x+5y-3z &= 4-3i \\
x+4y+z &= 2+i \\
\end{align*} 

Find the values of x, y, and z that satisfy the system of equations.
message_2:
To solve this system of linear equations, we can use the method of substitution or elimination. In this case, we will use the elimination method.

First, we will eliminate x from the second and third equations. To do this, we will multiply the first equation by 2 and the third equation by -3, then add the two equations:

(6x - 4y + 8z) + (-3x - 12y - 3z) = (-2 + 4i) + (-6 - 3i)

3x - 16y + 5z = -8 + i

Now we have a new system of equations:

\begin{align*}
3x-2y+4z &= -1+2i \\
3x-16y+5z &= -8+i \\
\end{align*}

Next, we will eliminate x from the new system of equations by subtracting the first equation from the second equation:

(3x - 16y + 5z) - (3x - 2y + 4z) = (-8 + i) - (-1 + 2i)

-14y + z = -7 - i

Now we have a new system of equations:

\begin{align*}
2x+5y-3z &= 4-3i \\
-14y+z &= -7-i \\
\end{align*}

To eliminate y, we will multiply the first equation by 14 and the second equation by 5, then add the two equations:

(28x + 70y - 42z) + (-70y + 5z) = (56 - 42i) + (-35 - 5i)

28x - 37z = 21 - 47i

Now we can solve for x:

28x = 37z - 21 + 47i

x = (37z - 21 + 47i) / 28

Now we will substitute this expression for x back into the third equation of the original system:

(37z - 21 + 47i) / 28 + 4y + z = 2 + i

Multiplying both sides by 28 to eliminate the fraction:

37z - 21 + 47i + 112y + 28z = 56 + 28i

Simplifying:

65z + 112y = 77 - 19i

Now we will substitute the expression for x back into the first equation of the original system:

3((37z - 21 + 47i) / 28) - 2y + 4z = -1 + 2i

Multiplying both sides by 28 to eliminate the fraction:

3(37z - 21 + 47i) - 56y + 112z = -28 + 56i

Simplifying:

111z - 63 + 141i - 56y + 112z = -28 + 56i

Combining like terms:

223z - 56y = 35 + 197i

Now we have a new system of equations:

\begin{align*}
65z + 112y &= 77 - 19i \\
223z - 56y &= 35 + 197i \\
\end{align*}

To eliminate y, we will multiply the first equation by 56 and the second equation by 112, then add the two equations:

(3640z + 6272y) + (24984z - 6272y) = (4312 - 1064i) + (3920 + 22064i)

Simplifying:

28624z = 8232 + 20900i

Now we can solve for z:

z = (8232 + 20900i) / 28624

z = (8232/28624) + (20900i/28624)

z = 2/7 + (20900/28624)i

z = 2/7 + (1045/14312)i

Now we can substitute the value of z back into the equation 65z + 112y = 77 - 19i:

65(2/7 + (1045/14312)i) + 112y = 77 - 19i

Simplifying:

130/7 + 67625/14312i + 112y = 77 - 19i

112y = 77 - 130/7 - 19i - 67625/14312i

112y = 9/7 - 19i - 67625/14312i

112y = 9/7 - (19 + 67625/14312)i

Now we can solve for y:

y = (9/7) / 112 - (19 + 67625/14312)i / 112

y = 1/14 - (19/112 + 1685/14312)i

y = 1/14 - (1/7 + 1685/14312)i

Now we have the values for x, y, and z:

x = (37z - 21 + 47i) / 28 = (37(2/7 + (1045/14312)i) - 21 + 47i) / 28 = 1/2 + (3/4)i

y = 1/14 - (1/7 + 1685/14312)i

z = 2/7 + (1045/14312)i

So the solution to the system of equations is:

x = 1/2 + (3/4)i
y = 1/14 - (1/7 + 1685/14312)i
z = 2/7 + (1045/14312)i
